text: - My name's Shara Barkovich,

and I'm a manager in the
Partner SI Organization,
focusing on consulting partners for AWS.

I've been in my role for
six years next month.

I've been in the Partner
Organization the entire six years
but I have had various roles.
One was Partner Development Manager,

and now I manage a team of
Partner Development folks.
(upbeat music)

I would say the biggest
takeaway in my first year

is that there's so much
potential for us to affect change
and to be creative in this role,
and to make that change happen quickly,
which was astonishing to me
with this being such a large organization.
There are a few important things to bring
to this role and the partner organization,
and one of them is customer obsession.

If you are customer obsessed,
that's already half of it.
And then the other side of it is,
you know, sales and marketing
and business development experience

is also really foundational
and important to the role,
and we look for that too.
(inspirational music)
I am lucky every day that I get to work
with a team of builders,

and we may not be builders
in the traditional sense
like you mentioned in software,
but where we build is with partners,
and we help them build their businesses.

We dive deep into the
details of what they do,

what they want to do, and what
their AWS superpowers are,

and then we help them work
backwards from those goals.

And so I'm proud to work
alongside builders every day,

and they're all through
the partner organization.

We have a lot of fun here
and we work really hard,

and those two together
make a great environment.
And it's really rewarding to get

to not only see your own
ideas come to fruition.
If you have a Think Big idea,
getting it implemented and working

with all different teams in
order to bring it forward.

But it's also really rewarding
to see our partner customers

achieve their goals and
have successful businesses
because of the work that we do every day.
